data.title: Add action to enable auto update to the extension viewlet drop down menu
data.body: User do not discover the auto update support for extensions. It is currently only exposed as a setting. Suggest to add a command to the Extension Viewlets drop down menu to enable auto updating.

data.title: node_modules folder hidden if excluded from jsconfig
data.body:
Having the line `"exclude": [ "node_modules" ]` in `jsconfig.json` hid the node_modules folder from the file explorer, which I believe is not the intended behavior. I was able to restore it by adding `"files.exclude": { "**/node_modules": false }` to my User Settings file. 

When this line is subsequently removed from User Settings and re-saved, the `node_modules` folder remains in the file explorer.

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Add `jsconfig.json` containing `"exclude": [ "node_modules" ]` to a Node.js project folder. (Folder has `package.json` with dependencies that haven't been installed yet.)
2. Run `npm install` in project. `node_modules` folder is created but does not appear in VS Code file explorer.
3. Unhide `node_modules` folder by adding `"files.exclude": { "**/node_modules": false }` to User Settings file.
4. When `"files.exclude": { "**/node_modules": false }` is removed from User Settings, `node_modules` folder remains unhidden.

Something here seems like it's not acting as expected.

data.title: [1.11.2] input.value auto-transforms to input.nodeValue
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: win7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

Just open simple script.js file,
get your input by it's id
and then try to get value of this input.

So when you will type **input.value.**  (with dot) VS Code will transform it to **input.nodeValue.**

![value - nodevalue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24613274/25352530/04419b6e-2935-11e7-870c-d8b807366461.gif)

So it makes a problem and crash in code.

data.title: Support projects (workspaces)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It looks very strange that VS Code doesn't support ability to create and use projects. Workspace settings is a project settings. It's projects support already in this editor. But requires some polishing...

I found it uncomfortable for me to create new `.vscode` folder inside the source code directory. Some extensions put there own cache files. I don't like it (because if I work vis sshfs, then it means that each change of this cache file will be transferred, that I don't like to do).

It's why I propose to tune-up current workspace ideology and enable out-of-the-box projects support. All what you need - to create for each new project new folder in the `~/.vscode/` with appropriate local workspace `settings.json` file.

In the end, it will look like this:
```bash
~/.vscode/
    settings.json
    project1/
        settings.json
        cache_file_for_some_plugin
    project2/
        settings.json
```

This structure will work fine, because you have the same global setting for all projects, and local settings per project (workspace).

It will be good if you will make this change, and it will make life much easier out-of-the box.

data.title: Very slow "Go to file..."
data.body:
I work with project over sshfs and it's pretty big (10k+ files). Every time when I need to jump to the file - it requires to wait half of the minute to find the file by name.

Can you please implement caching of the folders structure, like it done in the Sublime Text? It caches folders/files list in the background, allowing to jump to any file/folder very quickly.

And please, allow to save the cache outside of working directory. For example, in the `~/.vscode/project_name/` directory

data.title: JSON schema validation error is unclear
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|tslint|eg2|0.12.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.12.2|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a json file pointing to a schema using a max length on a string field
2. Have that field be longer than the max.
3. Hover over the green squiggly and observe the unclear text

Expected behavior: An error message along the lines of "String is longer than the maximum length"

Actual behavior: The error message is "String is shorter than the maximum length of". "shorter" should be "longer" and the dangling "of" doesn't make sense.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6445614/25346840/af4b535a-28cd-11e7-99cb-9d9622b0143e.png)

data.title: Improve keyboard shortcut editor search
data.body:
Currently the Keyboard Shortcuts editor allows to search for a command name:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5784415/25342476/06f46f2c-28c1-11e7-9a2b-a748032b130c.png)

It would be useful to be able to search for a key combination/chord as well:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5784415/25342508/18e8c73c-28c1-11e7-8fab-91848f3fc547.png)

Even better, it would be great to be able to search for any column name (Command, Keybinding, Source, When), something like:

> Keybinding: ctrl+k

data.title: Cannot install any extensions.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Win7 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VS Code.
2. Launch VS Code.
3. Press CTRL+SHIFT+X to open extensions view.
4. Select 'Show Recommended Extensions', (or seach for an extension).

Result:
A blue bar scrolls from left to right 5 times, then stops.

Expected:
To see a list of extensions to install.


Description:
New install of VSCode, on a workstation that does not connect to the Internet via a proxy. With no proxy configuration present either in VSCode config nor in environment variables. Attempting to search for an extention nothing happens. No error is displayed. Npm install on the command line works with no problem.

Is there not even a log or something I can view to perhaps get some kind of clue as to what is causing the problem?

P.S. Your documentation for guidance on how to submit a new issue is poor. It suggests checking this 'query' prior to submitting a new bug.
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3Afeature-request+sort%3Areactions-%2B1-desc

But this 'query' is just a list of 93 pages of existing issues. Not sure how anyone is expected to trawl through that.

data.title: Wrong TypeScript version is shown when using a workspace version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start a new node project.
2. Install a local version of TypeScript from node: `npm install typescript@1.8 --save-dev`.
3. Add the setting to use the workspace version of TypeScript: `"typescript.tsdk": "./node_modules/typescript/lib"`
4. Switch to the workspace version:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2734580/25335781/63111622-28ec-11e7-896f-37a67e31a548.png)

The command palette has picked up the correct version, but it's not shown at the bottom of the window:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2734580/25335826/97b0cbca-28ec-11e7-99bd-d08714ddbe7d.png)

data.title: Closing confirmation window when discarding changes confirms action
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:03:11.395Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|nord-visual-studio-code|arcticicestudio|0.1.1|
|aurelia|AureliaEffect|0.2.7|
|vscode-multi-line-tricks|bigous|0.0.3|
|vue|jcbuisson|0.1.5|
|code-beautifier|michelemelluso|1.7.2|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.13|;


---

When discarding changes, hitting escape on the confirmation window will accept and not cancel the action.
Same effect by closing the confirmation window using the close button.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Edit a file
2. On the git panel, hit discard change button on the edited file
3. Hit escape key after the confirmation window show.

data.title: Brackets cannot be copied to terminal running python with German keyboard as default

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Professional Version 6.1 (Build 7601: Service Pack 1)
- German keyboard by default (brackets need AltGr to be inputted)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. View -> Integrated Terminal
2. In Terminal: python
3. In Notepad write: print("[Hello]{World}")
4. In Notepad Ctrl-A (Select All), Edit -> Copy
5. In Terminal: Edit -> Paste
6. The Terminal now shows the command without brackets. This does not happand in cmd.exe

The Problem happens on a computer where the default language is German (The German keyboard needs AltGr to input the brackets). It does not matter what keyboard is used: German or English. I cannot input brackets with both.

If I change the **default** keyboard to English then the problem does not exist and I can input the brackets in python terminal. The problem only exists when the default keyboard is German.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1749072/25326426/6f2b0380-28d0-11e7-8def-c3f73256c1e5.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1749072/25326517/dd1f733a-28d0-11e7-8ace-0323c00d2fb1.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1749072/25326900/621bb6ba-28d2-11e7-9e00-06479625256b.png)

data.title: TypeScript validations occur even though javascript.validate.enable is false
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T07:56:42.517Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 14.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.6.0|
|vscode-flow-ide (disabled)|gcazaciuc|1.1.4|
|vscode-csscomb|mrmlnc|4.0.1|
|vscode-sort-json|richie5um2|1.9.0|;


---

I haven't been able to reproduce this reliably - it's intermittent, but very annoying regardless.

Even though "javascript.validate.enable" is false in my settings.json, I'm still getting typescript / javascript validation issues, eg:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/97317/25326648/7444b96c-2914-11e7-8763-a63ae280db2d.png)

My settings.json looks like this:
```js
{
    "editor.formatOnSave": true,
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
    "files.insertFinalNewline": true,
    "files.exclude": {
        "**/.git": true,
        "**/.svn": true,
        "**/.hg": true,
        "**/CVS": true,
        "**/.DS_Store": true,
        "**/.bundle": true,
        "**/.sass-cache": true,
        "**/.localeapp": true,
        "**/.git-hooks": true,
        "**/*.xz": true,
        "**/*.gz": true,
        "**/node_modules": true,
        "log": true,
        "tmp": true
    },
    "search.useIgnoreFilesByDefault": true,
    "javascript.validate.enable": false,
    "flow.useNPMPackagedFlow": true,
    "eslint.run": "onSave",
    "flow.runOnEdit": false,
    "javascript.format.enable": false,
    "csscomb.formatOnSave": true
}
```
